lines.text: Hey, I tell you what is. Big city, hmm? Live, work, huh? But not city only. Only peoples. Peoples is peoples. No is buildings. Is tomatoes, huh? Is peoples, is dancing, is music, is potatoes. So, peoples is peoples. Okay?
[Masterson Rat is infatuated with Brooke Shields]
Is something wrong?
Do you believe in interspecies dating?
Well, I've dated some rats before, if that's what you mean.
[Masterson faints]
Dad! Dad! I've got great news!
[Bernard sees Kermit]
If you two are in love, I don't wanna know about it.
[after contorting Kermit's legs, arm and mouth]
No doubt about it; you've got amnesia.
Maybe we should add more special effects like exploding socks.
What's this supposed to be?
Is grits! Grits! Hominy grits!
How should I know how many? Count 'em yourself.
Rats want job. Frog want job. What next, penguins?
[a group of penguins peek through the door]
Do you have any jobs available?
No!
Well, excuse us for living!
I'll pick up the bill today, Gil.
Oh, good. Something from the grill, Jill?
No, meat makes me ill, Gil.
I'm staying! You hear that, New York? THE FROG IS STAYING!
[the Swedish Chef is the popcorn vender at a movie theater showing a 3D film]
Yaa da poppin' corn is...
[throws popcorn in the air]
3D! Da corn is popping in your face inna...
[throws popcorn in his own face]
[Martin Price holds a gun on Gonzo's chicken]
Get back or the chicken gets it!
That's a threat?
[after Mr. Skeffington is done talking baby talk to his dog]
It's amazing. You speak Chinese like a native.
Hey! Watch it!
Oh, sorry. I gotta get a contract so I can go out and kill 'em.

[dismissing his suspicion after a moment]
Nahhhhh!

[Muppet Babies, singing]
She's gonna be a movie star. And she's gonna learn to drive a car; she's gonna be a vet'rinarian, too.
[to Kermit]
And I'm gonna always love you-ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh!
Well, she's gonna be a singer, whoa-whoa-whoa!
And she's gonna learn to fly a plane!
She'll be a doctor of diseases and help you with your sneezes...
...and practice neurosurgery on your brain!
Well, Waldorf, they finally made it to Broadway.
Yes, and I already bought tickets.
Are they good seats?
Sure are. They're on the next train out of town.
It's just like taking an ocean cruise, only there's no boat and you don't actually go anywhere.

[whispering]
Piggy, I thought Gonzo was gonna play the minister.
[laughs]

[singing]
Do you, Piggy, take this frog to be your lawful wedded husband? Do you?

[singing]
I do.

[singing]
Do you, Froggie, take this pig to be your lawful wedded wife until you die?

[hesitantly singing]
Well... I...

[singing]
Do you?

[as everyone else listens intently for his decision; still singing]
Well... I do.

[singing]
Then because you share a love so big, I now pronounce you Frog and Pig.
Can I get my skates back please?
Hey, hey just a second. How did you know about that "toupe"?
None of your beeswax!
Hey have you been spying on me?
I'll unlace them, while you fight. It's no trouble.
Piggy! Have you been spying on me?
Maybe spying on vous and that certain young girl of the opposite gender.
You two-timing her?
No that's just Jenny. She's a friend. She's a friend and she's been trying to help me sell the show.
Ha!

[to Piggy]
He's gotta sell the show.
[to Kermit]
What show?
Well if she is just a friend then what about the... the huggies?
What?

[shocked]
The Huggies! You gave Jenny the huggies?
You know maybe, maybe Kermit, maybe it would have been better if we had never have met. Then, then you and Jenny would not be tormented by my presence.
[sobbing]
Oh gee.
See what the huggies'll getcha?
[Kermit, suffering from amnesia, doesn't remember he is engaged to Miss Piggy]
Me? In love with a pig? Wait 'til I tell the guys in marketing.
[laughing]
su-EEEEE! Oink, oink!
Cancel the show! Hi-yah!
[Karate chops Kermit]

[talks on phone]
So I told him "Listen, buddy, I don't take my clothes off for anybody, even if it IS artistic".
Hey, look, Waldorf. It's the frog and the pig.
Yeah, it looks like they're in love.
Yeah.
Kinda makes you sick, doesn't it?
[they laugh]
Woo-hoo!
Hey, lovey doveys!
Hubba, hubba!
Mr. Mayor! Mr. Mayor, I'm looking for a frog who can sing and dance!
If he can balance the budget, I'll hire him!
[On seeing Beth]
Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't know this cave was co-ed.
Snookums prefers the rubber Wall Street Journal to the rubber Washington Post.
Don't we all?
I spy because I care!
Well I care, too!
Well, *why* don't you say so?
I JUST DID!
ALL RIGHT!
[They start screaming, then try to catch their breath]
Keep the skates. Keep the skates. I don't use 'em anyway; I just like to run around in shorts.
Well I told you... I want to do something different!
So put some Jell-O down your pants!
But, Pop, I told you - I want to do something different!
So put some Jell-O down your pants.
[Gonzo uses mouth-to-mouth resuicitation on his chicken]
Gonzo, is Camilla all right?
Yeah, but I think we're engaged!
[at the beginning of the movie during the play, Animal chases a young lady up a seating aisle]
WOMAN! WOMAN! WOMAN! WOMAN!
[he turns around and looks at the audience]
WOMAN! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!
[the Muppets have shacked up in bus station lockers]
I'll trade with anyone who has a Jacuzzi.
[after having Beth snuggle up to him]
K-k-kermit...
Does Snookums Wookums want a boney woney?

[to Snookums]
Hey, Squishy Bottom!

[to Snookums]
Little Binky Booter!
Hey, Kermit. Can our friends watch the show from backstage?

What? No! No, they cannot watch the show from backstage. That's it! That's what's been missing from the show! That's what we need! More frogs and dogs and bears and chickens and... and whatever! You're not gonna watch the show, you're gonna be in the show! Come on, everyone!
Ocean Breeze Soap will get you clean.
You mean just say what the product does?
No one's ever tried that before.
What's going on here?
Well... uh... we just got job offers. Uh... right guys?
[everyone lies with ad libs, "yeah", "sure", "job offers"]
That's great. But why do you all look so sad?
Well, it's just... they're kind of... out of town job offers. Right guys?
[more ad libs with "yes", "out of town", etc]
What job did I get?
Gonzo! Shut up!
I'm Jenny.
I'm Kermit.
[Long pause]
I'm a frog.

[after being taken hostage]
Gonzo, are you alright?
I just saw my life flash before my nose!

[serving up 2 fried eggs on toast with steak fries]
Hey Pete, here ya go. Two zeros on a trampoline with a side of Joan of Arc.

[Rizzo walks by with a plate of food]
Gangway! Coming through! Hey Watch it, will ya?
Hey, that waiter's a rat!
I'm glad we got no money, now I got no appetite.
Ok, what'll ya have?
The number for The Board Of Health!
May I see a menu, please?
Yankee bean soup... with spoon.

So the grizzly bear, he walks out of the room. Well, now, the panda bear is just sitting there, he thinks to himself , "This is odd". And then, what do you know, the phone rings. You know who it is? It's the polar bear, and the polar bear. he says to the panda bear, "I didn't know it was a koala bear!" Get it? "Koala?" Wocka wocka!
[On Manhattan Melodies]
Just because the whole thing is crazy doesn't mean it won't make it on Broadway!
Oh, dear Lord! Not jogging!
